edu.mit.jwi.dict
Interface IDictionary

All Known Implementing Classes:
Dictionary
public interface IDictionary

Objects that implement this interface are intended as the main entry point to accessing the dictionary data. The dictionary must be opened by calling open() before it is used. The dictionary allows the retrieval of four different types of objects: those that implement IIndexWord IWord, ISynset, and IExceptionEntry. These operations are achieved by constructing the appropriate ID object (that contains the minimum required information to retrieve the said object) and passing it to the appropriate method.

The current version is programmed with the Wordnet 2.1/3.0 specification in mind. Wordnet can be found at http://wordnet.princeton.edu/.

A number of interfaces are provided to assist in customizing dictionary behavior. The main ones are IDataProvider and IParserProvider. IFileProvider specifies methods that are used to create the objects that control the dictionary's access to lines in the data files. IParserProvider controls how the dictionary interprets the data in a particular line to create the objects it returns.

Since:
1.5
Version:
1.1, 4/28/07
Author:
Mark A. Finlayson

Method Detail

open

boolean open()
This opens this dictionary by instantiating objects corresponding to the data backing, such as files or socket connections. This method should be called before the dictionary is used.

This method is also be responsible for populating any fast-access maps that allow the other methods to easily find the right IDictionaryFile instance for their operations.

Returns:
true if there were no errors creating data backing objects; false otherwise.

close

void close()
This closes the dictionary by disposing of data backing objects or connections. It should not be irreversible, though: another call to open() should reopen the dictionary.

isOpen

boolean isOpen()
Returns:
true if the dictionary is open, that is, ready to accept queries; returns false otherwise

setDataProvider

void setDataProvider(IDataProvider provider)
Sets the data provider. If the dictionary is open, calling this method will throw

Parameters:
provider - the provider that provides lines from Wordnet data files

setParserProvider

void setParserProvider(IParserProvider provider)
Sets the parser provider and refreshes the individual line parsers. If null is passed to this method, all the individual parsers will also be set to null and the dictionary will not produce any new data.

Parameters:
provider - The provider that will provide the individual line parsers

getDataProvider

IDataProvider getDataProvider()
Returns:
the data provider for this dictionary

getParserProvider

IParserProvider getParserProvider()
Returns:
the parser provider for this dictionary

getIndexWord

IIndexWord getIndexWord(java.lang.String lemma,
                        PartOfSpeech pos)
This method should be identical to getIndexWord(IIndexWordID) and is provided as a convenience.

getIndexWord

IIndexWord getIndexWord(IIndexWordID id)
Fetches the specified index word object from the database. If the specified lemma/pos combination is not found, returns null.

getWord

IWord getWord(IWordID id)
Fetches the word from the database, as specified by the indicated IWordID object. If the specified id is not found, returns null

getSynset

ISynset getSynset(ISynsetID id)
Fetches the synset from the database, as specified by the indicated ISynsetID object. If the specified id is not found, returns null

getExceptionEntry

IExceptionEntry getExceptionEntry(java.lang.String surfaceForm,
                                  PartOfSpeech pos)
This method should be identical to getExceptionEntry(IExceptionEntryID), and is provided as a convenience.

getExceptionEntry

IExceptionEntry getExceptionEntry(IExceptionEntryID id)
Fetches the exception entry from the database, as specified by the indicated ISynsetID object. If the specified id is not found, returns null

getIndexWordIterator

java.util.Iterator<IIndexWord> getIndexWordIterator(PartOfSpeech pos)
Returns an iterator that will iterate over all index words of the specified part of speech.

getIndexWordPatternIterator

java.util.Iterator<IIndexWord> getIndexWordPatternIterator(PartOfSpeech pos,
                                                           java.lang.String pattern)
Returns an iterator that will iterate over all index words of the specified part of speech whose lemmas match the specified pattern. The wildcards are allowed, and what constitutes a 'match' is implementation dependent.

getSynsetIterator

java.util.Iterator<ISynset> getSynsetIterator(PartOfSpeech pos)
Returns an iterator that will iterate over all synsets of the specified part of speech.

getExceptionEntryIterator

java.util.Iterator<IExceptionEntryProxy> getExceptionEntryIterator(PartOfSpeech pos)
Returns an iterator that will iterate over all exception entries of the specified part of speech.
